sen.j: 小野川 喜三郎（おのがわ きさぶろう、1758年（宝暦8年） - 1806年4月30日（旧暦文化 (元号)3年3月12日 (旧暦)））は、大相撲の江戸相撲の力士。
sen.e: Kisaburo ONOGAWA (1758 to April 30, 1806) was an Edo sumo wrestler of the Grand Sumo Tournament.
Kisaburo ONOGAWA (1758 to April 30, 1806) was an Edo sumo wrestler of the Grand Sumo Tournament.
Kisaburo ONOGAWA (1758 to April 30, 1806) was an Edo sumo wrestler of the Grand Sumo Tournament.

sen.j: 5代横綱。
sen.e: He was a Five generation grand champion sumo wrestler.
He was the fifth Yokozuna (grand champion sumo wrestler).
sen.cmt: five generation をthe fifthに訂正しました。
sen.e: He was the fifth Yokozuna (grand champion sumo wrestler).

sen.j: 近江国（大津市)京町出身。
sen.e: He came from Kyomachi of Omi Province (Otsu City).
He came from Kyomachi of Omi Province (Otsu City).
He came from Kyomachi of Omi Province (Otsu City).

sen.j: 本名は川村喜三郞。
sen.e: His real name Kisaburo KAWAMURA.
His real name was Kisaburo KAWAMURA.
sen.cmt: 動詞が抜けていました。
sen.e: His real name was Kisaburo KAWAMURA.

sen.j: 寛政元年（1789年）11月、吉田司家吉田追風から谷風梶之助 (2代)とともに実質最初の横綱を免許された。
sen.e: In November, 1789, he was was licensed really as the first grand champion sumo wrestler from Oikaze YOSHIDA of Tsukasake YOSHIDA family with Kajinosuke TANIKAZE (second generation).
In November, 1789, he was licensed as the first Yokozuna along with Kajinosuke TANIKAZE (the second) from Oikaze YOSHIDA of Tsukasa YOSHIDA family.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: In November, 1789, he was licensed as the first Yokozuna along with Kajinosuke TANIKAZE (the second) from Oikaze YOSHIDA of Tsukasa YOSHIDA family.

sen.j: 征夷大将軍徳川家斉観戦の寛政3年（1791年）6月11日 (旧暦)谷風梶之助 (2代)と上覧相撲をおこなうなど寛政の繁栄期を築いた。
sen.e: On June 11, 1791 when Ienari TOKUGAWA, the Barbarian Subduing General watched the tournament, he built the prosperity period of joranzumo (sumo match held in front of the Emperor) with Kajinosuke TANIKAZE (second generation).

He helped to sumo to flourish during Kansei Period by holding the joranzumo (sumo match held in front of the Emperor) with Kajinosuke Tanikaze (the second) for the Barbarian Subduing General Ienari TOKUGAWA on June 11, 1791.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: He helped to sumo to flourish during Kansei Period by holding the joranzumo (sumo match held in front of the Emperor) with Kajinosuke Tanikaze (the second) for the Barbarian Subduing General Ienari TOKUGAWA on June 11, 1791.

sen.j: 初代小野川 (年寄名跡)の養子となって大坂相撲で初土俵を踏みのちに江戸相撲に合流した。
sen.e: He became the first generation ONOGAWA's (sumo stable-master name system) adopted son, and joined the Edo sumo wrestling after stepping in the first ring in the Osaka sumo wrestling.

He became Onogawa the first's (a retired wrestler who was a trustee of the Japan Sumo) adopted son, and joined the Edo sumo wrestling after entering the sumo ring for the first time in the Osaka sumo wrestling.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: He became Onogawa the first's (a retired wrestler who was a trustee of the Japan Sumo) adopted son, and joined the Edo sumo wrestling after entering the sumo ring for the first time in the Osaka sumo wrestling.

sen.j: 江戸では久留米藩のお抱えだった。
sen.e: In Edo, he held the Kurume clan.
In Edo, he was employed by the Kurume domain.
sen.cmt: 原文と意味が一致していません。
sen.e: In Edo, he was employed by the Kurume domain.

sen.j: 天明2年(1782年)3月場所7日目、当時大関の谷風の63連勝を、二段目の小野川が止めた。
sen.e: During the seventh day in the sumo tournament of March, 1782, ONOGAWA of the second act stopped the 63 successive victories of the contemporary second highest rank champion sumo wrestler TANIKAZE.

During the seventh day in the sumo tournament held in March, 1782, ONOGAWA who was in the lowest division stopped Ozeki (a sumo wrestler of the second highest rank) Tanikaze from wining who had won 63 matches in a raw.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: During the seventh day in the sumo tournament held in March, 1782, ONOGAWA who was in the lowest division stopped Ozeki (a sumo wrestler of the second highest rank) Tanikaze from wining who had won 63 matches in a raw.

sen.j: 谷風と小野川の取り組みは、大相撲史上に残る名勝負として語り継がれている。
sen.e: The tournament between TANIKAZE and ONOGAWA is handed down as a famous competition that remains in the Grand Sumo Tournament history.
The match between Tanikaze and Onogawa is handed down as a famous competition in the Grand Sumo Tournament history.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: The match between Tanikaze and Onogawa is handed down as a famous competition in the Grand Sumo Tournament history.

sen.j: 体躯、膂力にすぐれる谷風に対して、慎重な取り口と技巧で対抗した。
sen.e: Contrast to the excellent body and muscular arm power of TANIKAZE, he counteracted with a careful pushing and pulling technique.
While Tanikaze had a well-built figure with great physical strength, Onokawa competed with carefully planned strategy and techniques.
sen.cmt: 原文と意味が一致していません。
sen.e: While Tanikaze had a well-built figure with great physical strength, Onokawa competed with carefully planned strategy and techniques.

sen.j: そのために作戦的な立ち合いも多く、江戸の庶民の人気は薄かった。
sen.e: For that, there were many strategic tachiai (the initial charge), and the popularity of the common people in Edo was thin.
For that reason, there were many strategic tachiai (the initial charge), and it was not as popular among the commoners in Edo.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: For that reason, there were many strategic tachiai (the initial charge), and it was not as popular among the commoners in Edo.

sen.j: しかし、谷風梶之助、雷電爲右エ門の両強豪に挟撃されながらも歴代でも一級の戦績を残した。
sen.e: However, even though he was attacked from both sides by the two veterans Kajinosuke TANIKAZE and Tameemon RAIDEN, he still successively left behind the tournament records of the first class.
However, even though he was being followed by two powerful wrestlers Kajinosuke TANIKAZE and Tameemon RAIDEN, he still left the top-ranking record in history.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: However, even though he was being followed by two powerful wrestlers Kajinosuke TANIKAZE and Tameemon RAIDEN, he still left the top-ranking record in history.

sen.j: 「大相撲史上最強のナンバー2」と評される。
sen.e: He was evaluated as "the Strongest No.2 in the history of Grand Sumo Tournament".
He was named as "the Strongest No.2 (meaning Ozeki) in the history of Grand Sumo Tournament".
sen.cmt: No.2では意味が曖昧なので(meaning Ozeki)を付け加えました。
sen.e: He was named as "the Strongest No.2 (meaning Ozeki) in the history of Grand Sumo Tournament".

sen.j: ちなみに雷電との対戦は小野川が最盛期を過ぎた頃で、江戸では一度も勝てなかった。
sen.e: By the way, fighting with RAIDEN was when ONOGAWA passed his prime, and he could not win even once in Edo.
The match with RAIDEN was held when Onogawa had passed his peak and was unable to win even once in Edo.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: The match with RAIDEN was held when Onogawa had passed his peak and was unable to win even once in Edo.

sen.j: 通算成績は幕内23場所144勝13敗4分10預3無勝負40休、勝率9割1分7厘。
sen.e: The totaling results were: first-grade wrestlers 23 tournaments with 144 victories 13 defeats four evens, ten ends in a tie, three even 40 rests, the chance of success being 91.7 percent.

His total records were: first-grade wrestler, 23 tournaments with 144 victories, 13 defeats, 4 evens, 10 was undecided, three matches not held, 40 absences, and the winning percentage being 91.7 percent.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: His total records were: first-grade wrestler, 23 tournaments with 144 victories, 13 defeats, 4 evens, 10 was undecided, three matches not held, 40 absences, and the winning percentage being 91.7 percent.

sen.j: 優勝相当成績7回。
sen.e: The number of times he won the tournament was 7.
The number of times he won the tournament was 7.

sen.j: 体格は身長176センチ、体重135キロと伝わる。
sen.e: It is said that his physique was of height 176 centimeters, and weight 135 kilograms.
It is said that his height was 176 cm and his weight was 135 kg.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: It is said that his height was 176 cm and his weight was 135 kg.

sen.j: 横綱免許授与後最も多く使用した四股名は小野川喜三郎だ。
sen.e: After he was awarded the grand champion sumo wrestler license, the most frequent used sumo wrestler's professional name was Kisaburo ONOGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After he was awarded the Yokozuna license, the most frequently used sumo wrestler's name was Kisaburo ONOGAWA.
After he was awarded the Yokozuna license, the most frequently used sumo wrestler's name was Kisaburo ONOGAWA.

sen.j: しかし、大関の時（当時は横綱免許と番付は無関係）は小野川才助と書かれていた。
sen.e: However, when he was a champion sumo wrestler (at that time, the grand champion sumo wrestler license and the ranking were irrelevant), his name was written as Saisuke ONOGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, when he was Ozeki (at that time, Yokozuna license and the ranking were irrelevant), his name was written as Saisuke ONOGAWA.
sen.cmt: 原文と意味が一致していません。 yokozunaに書き換えました。
sen.e: However, when he was Ozeki (at that time, Yokozuna license and the ranking were irrelevant), his name was written as Saisuke ONOGAWA.

sen.j: 現在、「小野川 (年寄名跡)」は日本相撲協会の年寄名跡のひとつ。
sen.e: At present, "ONOGAWA (sumo stable-master name system)" is one of sumo stable-master name systems of Japan Sumo Association.
At present, "ONOGAWA (sumo stable-master name system)" is one of sumo stable-master name systems of Japan Sumo Association.
At present, "ONOGAWA (sumo stable-master name system)" is one of sumo stable-master name systems of Japan Sumo Association.

sen.j: 2009年5月現在、元前頭10枚目・潮丸元康が襲名している。
sen.e: As of May, 2009, the tenth former maegashira (sumo wrestlers in the makuuchi [senior-grade] division who rank below the komusubi) Motoyasu USHIOMARU have succeeded to the name.
As of May, 2009, the former tenth maegashira (sumo wrestlers in the senior-grade division whose rank is below the komusubi) Motoyasu USHIOMARU succeeded the name.
sen.cmt: グラマーに問題がありました。
sen.e: As of May, 2009, the former tenth maegashira (sumo wrestlers in the senior-grade division whose rank is below the komusubi) Motoyasu USHIOMARU succeeded the name.

sen.j: 所有者は北の湖敏満（前日本相撲協会理事長）。
sen.e: The owner is Toshimitsu KITANOUMI (the former administrative director of Nihon Sumo Kyokai (Japan Sumo Association).
The current owner of this name is Toshimitsu KITANOUMI (the former administrative director of Nihon Sumo Kyokai (Japan Sumo Association).
sen.cmt: the owner isでは意味が曖昧なので the current owner of this nameに訂正しました。
sen.e: The current owner of this name is Toshimitsu KITANOUMI (the former administrative director of Nihon Sumo Kyokai (Japan Sumo Association).
